intro: Allantodia obtusipinnula, commonly known as the broad-leaved allantodia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
